website_summaries.verdict: The 3D Innovations DeskCycle lets you pedal your way to better health while working at your desk, but it's an approach that may not fit every office or office worker.
pros: Self-contained design is mess- and maintenance-free
Digital readout for time, speed, distance, and calories burned

customer_reviews.title: I'm hoping there's an easy fix.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a loud knocking noise with every rotation. I can't find how to contact the company. Since it's so big and heavy I really don't want to go through the hassle of exchanging it. I'm hoping there's an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Yates

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: Really perfect for me. I have averaged about 50 miles per day and have lost 4 pounds in one week. Really well built and totally silent. I'm 5'8 and I do have to sit in a low chair but it works well and I do computer work and talk on the phone while burning about 1000 calories a day! You can't beat that. I was looking at more expensive solutions but I won't look anymore. Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Deskellent Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made product. It's quiet, it has good resistence, and the read out monitor is a nice feature. The only problem is, no matter how hard I pedal, I'm still at work. :(
customer_reviews.author: PuffyPinkCow

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it 10 stars I would
customer_reviews.text: I loved this so much at my desk at work that I bought a second one for my home office. It is silent and so smooth to pedal. Quick and easy assembly. While the calorie counter isn’t accurate, it is super easy to use the website to calculate calories burned. I got this to help me recover from a sublox patella fracture. I am averaging 4 hours and 70 miles a day while I am at work, burning almost 700 extra calories.
customer_reviews.author: star

customer_reviews.title: Has resistance setting issues, but makers say upcoming "Ellipse" model's settings can be fine-tuned
customer_reviews.text: The one huge flaw of the DeskCycle (v1 or v2) is that there's no setting between "almost effortless" and "requires super-intense pushing" – setting 3 has almost no resistance, but setting 4 is a huge challenge. At 5 and above, the minimal leverage you can get while seated makes it extremely difficult to pedal much at all. However, I reached out to 3D Innovations, and they say a new "Ellipse" model coming in November will have a linear resistance curve. This will hopefully give the product more flexibility, so consider waiting for that model to release. Aside from this issue, the DeskCycle is a phenomenal product.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Huth

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: The amount of noise this thing makes is unreal. It might be quiet if you rarely use it, but this is not for long term use. Customer service refuses to help explain how to maintain it. They think its indestructible. I am throwing this out after maybe 6 months of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie guiffre

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable for sloths, Fun for fitness buffs
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended for sloths. Am pedaling as I write this. It takes a bit of trial and error to get it the correct distance from you, but eventually, you'll figure it out. I've got it on "1" setting which is the least resistance but I can rev it up as I get better. Love the ability to put the readout on my desk. BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rockstahls

customer_reviews.title: It helps to keep me awake at work
customer_reviews.text: I use it at work, it's great!! It helps to keep me awake and my blood flowing. Since I work on the computer all day it helps. I really like that I can put the little digital thingy on my desk, I don't have to squat under my desk to read it.
customer_reviews.author: Mitymom

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Resistance Dial
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for literally 5 minutes until the resistance dial broke. I am surprised the plastic is so flimsy considering the rest of the bike seems very sturdy. I fixed the dial with duct tape, but this fix may not last because of the necessary tension between the internal spring that is attached to the dial. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: lwilson

customer_reviews.title: THE REAL DEAL
customer_reviews.text: This is a little piece of equipment, but a surprisingly solid and totally functional little piece. It surprises me every time I use it! Extremely quiet too. A true wonder. Most satisfied. BTW, if you are using a desk chair on wheels and are having troubles with it moving around while pedling, just swivel and hook one of the wheels so that it lies in FRONT of the back base leg. That will keep the chair in place.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Won't assemble - completely mis-threaded
customer_reviews.text: Pedals wouldn't screw in. Completely mis-threaded. While the construction quality otherwise seems fine, it's basically useless due to this defect. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who can't get to PT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother who had a knee replacement and was not able to continue with her PT due to the Covid 19 closing all facilities. It was shipped directly to her. She assembled it by herself and uses it daily for about an hour. She keeps it on level 1 as she does not need to increase resistance. However, after using for two weeks part of the machine (keeps track of time and calories burned) broke. This should not happen! She has contacted the company to see if they will replace.
customer_reviews.author: Second Grade Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Great desk, very noisy by the second week
customer_reviews.text: Work at home is great, until you realize how much you are not walking around. I purchased this to exercise while I work, and in general, it is a great exercise tool. My only complaint is the noise that has developed shortly after I started using it. At tension 3, there was no noise, but now that I've notched it up to tension 4, it is a creaky, noisy machine. I continue to use it but have to avoid it for all calls and meetings, as the sound would carry into the audio. It sounds like the plastic shell is being torqued apart. I would recommend with reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use and moves around when using it
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan, it is definitely not for me. I should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: The idea of being able to peddle at your desk is a good idea but this cycle does not fit well under most chairs and the profile makes it difficult to sit in a normal chair and use it without back support. I tried office and regular chairs. I would not recommend spending the money on this.
customer_reviews.author: quiltdolly

customer_reviews.title: Some problems that were easily resolved with non-slip furniture pads.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Sturdy - Good resistance levels Cons: - Will not level. We have tried leveling it again and again but the connection for the front legs is not aligned properly. This causes some rocking. - Sliding. I don't care how you pedal this, there is going to be some sliding on hard wood floors. - The calorie counter is wildly inaccurate and shouldn't even be included. Just throw it away. The good news is the leveling and sliding were both fixed with rubber/felt non-slip furniture pads. So an additional $5 and we were good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny D

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly well built
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to get more exercise when I started working completely remotely. I was a little concerned that an under the desk bike would be built cheesy and not give me the exercise I was looking for - but the reviews on this one seemed good. I was very pleasantly surprised at how well its made and how much better I feel at the end of the day. I really like the feature that I can put the odometer on my desk to see how much I’ve used it as the day progresses. I would definitely recommend it and think it was worth the price with how well its built.
customer_reviews.author: lindach

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, quiet and well made
customer_reviews.text: Received the under desk exercise bike today. I'm not mechanically inclined but it only took about 10 minutes to put together. There is a provided, and comically large, wrench tool to tighten the nuts. I bought this to exercise my legs while watching TV. I just tried it out on the carpet in front of my TV watching chair. There was no slippage on the carpet. I used it on setting 3 for a few minutes. The unit was extremely smooth, quiet and IMO well made (solid). Right now I am giving it a 5 star rating. If it causes me problems in the near future, I'll be back to change the rating.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Love the bike, but the velcro is a pain
customer_reviews.text: The big is great. The velcro drives me nuts! In order to sit close enough to my desk to type without strain, I have to put the bike far under the desk. I'm on tile floor so I can't use this thing without securing my chair in some way. I can't properly secure the velcro tight enough while sitting in my chair, BUT if I get out of the chair and crawl down to secure it, I can't get back in the chair. I have to have someone help me secure the thing every time I want to use it. Really poor design choice for an otherwise great product. The velcro makes me not want to deal with it though.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: Really bad product and customer service stay away
customer_reviews.text: The product does not connect to phone as falsely advertised. The customer service is callous and laid back.
customer_reviews.author: ravi

customer_reviews.title: LITERALLY one of the best purchases of my LIFE
customer_reviews.text: Not even kidding. I'm 5'5" and my knees don't hit my desk when using this. It's super smooth and super quiet. I use it a lot during meetings, I mean you can tell I'm cycling under my desk but it's not disruptive (other people have treadmill desks so) I average 1-2 hours a day on it now and it's great to get the blood flowing to my legs and add a little exercise to the day. You can set it so low you forget you're using it (if you just want bloodflow) or set it higher and get out of breath (for a little cardio) It's perfect :D
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Was a mistake
customer_reviews.text: You're better off buying a normal workout bike. Wish I could return this. The problem is it feels way too uncomfortable and you won't get the same workout for your core, and it is tough on the knees.
customer_reviews.author: Joon

customer_reviews.title: I am a little frustrated because I have enjoyed getting the exercise and after only a month of ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a little frustrated because I have enjoyed getting the exercise and after only a month of riding, there is an annoying ticking sound.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit under the table
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t fit under the tableI Purchased, I Purchased this to use while I was sitting at the table on my iPad. It will not fit underneath the table when you go to pedal you hit the top of the table so I don’t really understand why they say it’s made for under desks and tables
customer_reviews.author: Gscakes

customer_reviews.title: Great for circulation!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these machines for my 85 year old mother that has a lot of health issues. Her legs were very swollen due to immobility that concerned her doctors and family. When the machine arrived I had my mom use it for the first time 2 minutes around noon and 2 minutes early evening and it made all the difference in the world in her mobility! This unit is great for seniors and anyone that sits too much.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Spud

customer_reviews.title: What a great lower half workout !
customer_reviews.text: Wow, is all I can say. I was skeptical at first about the effectiveness of this. Well, after the first couple hours my thighs were more sore than they have been with my full body workouts and my elliptical. I will say I'm short and our desks at work are about average size. I feel if you are much taller you might have an issue with this under you desk but I fit just fine. I'm in a recumbent bike position most of the time and I had this on a resistance of 2 the first time and again my thighs are burning! It's quiet as can be too!
customer_reviews.author: S A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Deskcycle is a godsend in my opinion! Super quick delivery and excellent customer service. The bike was super easy to assemble and I have plenty as space underneath my desk for working out without hitting my knees against the table. I'm 5 feet 4 inches tall and my table is 28 inches from the floor. It feels like really good quality and I've started out at level 2 building up quite a sweet while working at the same time. It's quiet as can be and I've added around 4-5 hours of pedaling to my daily workout routine and am already starting to see the results on the scale. It's definitely a total win!!! I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Esben Retbøll

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Invention
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't they have this years ago? Best idea ever, I love it. I spend 90% of the day sitting at my computer, working. My legs swell & I'm turning into a chair potato. With this "under the desk peddler", I can exercise while working. I have the digital display on my desktop so I can keep track of Distance/Speed/Time/Calories. I no longer have to figure out how to make time to exercise! It was easy to put together, didn't need any help from my husband. I placed it against the wall under my desk (my desk has a clearance of 27") & I'm able to have my legs underneath while using.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great for rehab after knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had my knee replaced in February and have been going to Physical Therapy. My Medicare ran out and I was told by my therapist that the one single thing I should focus on other than a few exercises would be peddling a bike. I purchased this with many doubts. It arrived yesterday and I have to say I love it. It feels very well put together, sturdy and smooth. I am without the slightest bit of doubt that this will help me improve my range of motion. Wish I had purchased it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: Initial cycle needed replacing but they made it right!
customer_reviews.text: I am leaving a two-star review due to the fact that I have only had my DeskCycle for a few weeks, and it is already making noises and "clicking" when I peddle. I followed the website's troubleshooting instructions, but it did not help. Since I work in an office, I can hardly use a bike that makes noise as I peddle. Otherwise, I absolutely loved the machine and have used it every day since I got it. But unfortunately, this bike will need to be replaced. Such a hassle! Update: They replaces my bike, no problems since. Great service, easy. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my deskcycle! Some days I can burn up to 700 calories! I have even been sore from peddling! Also- this machine is quiet, and it had 8 intensity levels (I normally keep mine at 4). Probably the best $200 I've spent in a long time! Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin22

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult to use this in an office environment. The force required to pedal pushes your chair, furniture, etc. around and will impede the efforts, even if you are using the strap. Maybe this would work in situations where you have everything fixed in place, that is your chair doesn't move or is somehow fixed to the floor. But in a normal office setting, for me, this doesn't do anything except slide around and pull you out of alignment with the machine, making it impossible to get a workout. I regret buying it, a good idea in theory but just doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Jay Gee

customer_reviews.title: Update:  ID10T error....
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a rather scathing review only to realize I had assembled the cycler incorrectly. Take Two... with my carefully reassembling the pieces in the correct order. The DeskCycler is quiet, I like that the tension can be adjusted. My only complaint would be the velcro straps on the peddles. I know they are there to help your feet stay in place, but when the machine is placed under the desk, it makes placing your feet onto the peddles difficult as the straps get in the way and your desk prevents you from being able to reach the straps to adjust them.
customer_reviews.author: Mythral

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: It works! I'm in school and work full time in an office which means my schedule does not allow for much physical activity. This keeps me company and awake at night while I read, helps circulation and gives me some much needed exercise. I have wood floors so it does slip a bit when using it, but the Velcro tie they provide solves the problem, I tie it to my office chair and pedal away! With that tie it doesn't move. The resistance is great, I have not gone past 2 since my aim is not a full workout, but it still gives me a good maintenance workout. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Classic2Day

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you have hard floors
customer_reviews.text: Completely useless if you have hard floors, and they try to force you to buy expensive upgrades for it. It slides around, your chair slides around, and you slide around. No stability at all out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Murphy

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Deskcycle as part of a pre-surgical workout for my knee replacement. It is important that I be able to move it from room to room and change the resistance level. It keeps track of time, distance, rpm and other things that I don't care about. It makes absolutely no noise, and because I have it on carpet does not move at all. Love it! I expect my upcoming knee surgery will be greatly aided by this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jackieg

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely constructed, sturdy and while I didn't try on a wood/tile floor, it does not slide on carpeting. My error for not checking prior but it actually does not work under my desk since my knees hit. This is something I'd measure or check before ordering if you can.... But, I moved it to our den and pedal away while watching tv which is just as great! Low noise and plenty of 'bells & whistles' to make your work-out effective. A+
customer_reviews.author: NBrown

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: First few months of working from home I started having severe body ache due to the lack of exercise. I thought about purchasing this for awhile and finally bought it. It has been a game changer. I have no pain any more! Throughout the day I will find the few minutes each time to use this desk cycle. I aim for 60 minutes total by end of the day. It totally changed how I feel after sitting at my desk for work all day!
customer_reviews.author: Babharu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect low intensity physical therapy!
customer_reviews.text: Great desk cycle especially for my mom. My mother who is a young 92 broke her hip in a fall and came through surgery great. Later however, about 7 weeks after surgery she acquired a blood clot in her other leg. This may be coincidental but the morning after she used the desk cycle (on the lowest intensity) her leg was less swollen! Today we make sure she uses it each day while she watches a tv show. I also love the fact that it shows how many calories she’s burned...we add another cookie to her diet when she peddles those calories away!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This thing actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my DeskCycle yesterday afternoon. I've already put 4 hours in at resistance level 1. I can say without any doubt that this thing works. I even broke a light sweat this morning after going for about 45 minutes. Make sure you adjust both your chair as well as the DeskCycle position. Otherwise you'll find yourself banging a knee (I'm 5'10 so it might just be my body shape). Also, you may want to invest in a set of these if your chair is on wheels.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hughvers

customer_reviews.title: Cycler Great, Display Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: The Desk CyCle works great, and was easy to assemble. The display did not work because the connector to the display is on the opposite side of where the display sits. When I called customer service, I was told that it would work without the connector, which of course it doesn't. It only shows numbers that don't work. I would have rated the machine 5 stars, but with a worthless display, I feel the value of the unit is decreased. Customer Service did not resolve my issue, so that is why I am rating this 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Walking and other similar forms of exercise are hard for me because of back issues. I usually get my exercise in the pool. But, with current issues, the gyms are closed so I don’t have access to a pool. I bought this desk cycle for my home. I am able to use it to get some leg exercise done. It’s a quick and inexpensive way to get a bike exercise machine in the house when the stores and gyms are closed.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: THE PEDAL ASSEMBLY IS INCCREDIBLY STUPID
customer_reviews.text: seems simple enough to attach the pedals. You put a threaded bolt into the crank. Except you have to hold the bolt still as you thread it in a very tight space. The main thing is IT WILL NOT THREAD. I've tried over two days, even had somebody help me and IT WILL NOT THREAD! They say "be sure that the bolt is straight" IT IS STRAIGHT AND IT STILL WON'T THREAD. It's not like I haven't done this before. Returning it because IT'S TOO STUPID TO BELIEVE.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Day

customer_reviews.title: Like this cycle! Don't think just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Great cycle, I do use it every single minute when I work. I'd recommend everybody who is sedentary. The one thing i don't like is a smell, rubber inside smells horrible to death and cause some problems with breath! After a while Right pedal feels broken. However, the cycle is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dylan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was very easy to assemble. Nothing was broken, took no time. While I plan to use in my home office and when watching TV, I don’t think I’d use it in the actual office. I sit in a small room with 5 others and while it’s quiet I think it would be distracting. So far it works great. I’ll update later on if my fat ass actually loses some weight.
customer_reviews.author: Itsrob11

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a week as a replacement for another similar exercise bike that I was borrowing. This is quieter and works just as well to help with rehab after my hip surgery. I put it beside my bed and use it first thing in the morning as I drink my coffee. The display is handy in that you can put it on the readout that you want. I like it on the timer, but you can choose another or have it cycle through the other feedback as you pedal. I'm really glad that I got this model. I was looking at something less expensive, but I think this is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: L K Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for knee replacement therapy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second peddler. Since my first bike, I've had two complete knee replacements. I've just been diagnosed with RA. Before my surgeries, I used a walker to get around. This bike helped me to recover from total knee replacement. I got up to 70 miles a day. It prepared me for my second surgery...which was a breeze. Within two weeks I was able to walk stairs, and only needed a cane. This peddler allowed me to get healthy again. Great product! I have peddled thousands of miles... looking forward to #2!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheehawka

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What We Needed
customer_reviews.text: This product was bought for my brother who suffered a stroke a few years ago. He gets around ok but found that the winter months when he is not very active was making him weak. He had lost quite a bit of his balance and strength in the legs. We bought the pedal exerciser to see if it would help. It was easy to assemble with clear instructions. We placed it in my brother's living room just in front of one of his chairs. He says he cannot do very much at a time but what he has done has increased is mobility greatly. He can now walk in the house without a cane. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Neettweet

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: So I hate to exercise, but we all know that it’s important for our health. Because of this little machine, for the first time in my life, I’m actually exercising on a regular basis and not hating it. I use it at night while I watch TV and read. It only take about 10-15 minutes to put together and I love that it’s so small and easy to move. Plus it wasn’t that expensive, so it was an easy choice to try. If you’re like me and can’t stand to exercise, this might be a great way to go.
customer_reviews.author: ddkrdh

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. I'm too short for the average exercise bike so I set this up with a chair. Presto, I have a recumbent exercise bike! Works great, almost no noise at all. I have used it every day for 30-45 minutes since I got it and it works great. Does not take up much room in my living room. It seems to be made well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: It will not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. I had a few health problems and I had to hold off using it. I finally am able to use it again and the pedal fell off. It looks like the threads are stripped so it can't be put back on. So, starts off great but durability and quality are a problem.
customer_reviews.author: K. Reed

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months a pedal fell off
customer_reviews.text: I loved my deskcycle, I was using it 5 days a week for at least 5 hours a day while at work. One day the left pedal unscrewed and fell off. It will not screw back in, the thread looks mangled. I am so disappointed. After my back injury this was the only exercise I could do without further injuring my back.
customer_reviews.author: STNY

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have room for a full sized exercise bike this is a great alternative
customer_reviews.text: My apartment is small so I wanted something moveable, and this is perfect. It sits under my desk both when I'm using it and when I'm just doing regular work. Unfortunately my desk is not tall enough to use it while I'm comfortably seated, so I only move it into position when I've taken a break to watch shows. The display is easily readable, the resistances are easy to switch (though I don't go above 3 right now), and the set up was a breeze. It only weighs about 30 pounds so it's easy to slide around. A definite good investment for the cold months.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for seamless workouts when you can multitask
customer_reviews.text: I lost 100+lbs in partial thanks to using this device as I used it among other things. It has truly helped me. If your are int he mood of bringing a series, just hop on the desk-cycle while doing so. The time will fly by as you grow more healthier than ever before. Just be sure to use the max-resistance settings as sparingly as possible as it may cause some ware to the belts. Medium to Low resistances are ideal. I would recommend this device to anyone seeking a more healthy lifestyle but just can't find the time to go to the gym. If I could give it 10 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron S.

customer_reviews.title: This is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think you could use this much more than I have for the past year. I use it approximately 2 to 3 hours each day. I started because I needed to find something that burns calories other than walking so I could ‘buy’ myself more calories to eat on my weight loss journey with noom. 12 months later, 90 pounds lighter, It has become a habit. As a matter fact I bought a second one to have at another residence where I spend significant time. It’s light enough to transport but frankly it was just easier to buy another one. This is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Veepka

customer_reviews.title: Works well; heavy to move
customer_reviews.text: We really like this bike. We use it at home, and it helps us keep active even if we watch TV. It has enough weight to stay put while you pedal, which is much better than cheaper models we've used in the past. It's easy to move, and I can lift it with one hand, but it's just heavy and awkward enough that I don't move it more than I have to. I wouldn't want it lighter, though, because then it would wobble. The rubber foot on one end keeps falling off (currently lost, probably under the couch), but other than that, the bike works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Trusock

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, but not for rolling chairs
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this bike. There is quite a bit of online discussion about using it with a rolling chair. This works best with a fixed-leg chair that is not on rollers. Lots of work-arounds can be done, but the flimsy strap that comes with it is a complete waste. The actual pedal function of the bike works perfectly. My three stars relates to the fact that using it at work is much harder than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend:)
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about it! I use it everyday under my desk, it’s silent. I keep it at level 3 which can get me out of breath, but it could be adjusted much harder. I’m 35 yr. old female, in pretty good shape and bought it for some exercise while working from home. I have it on carpet and a rug, cornered under my desk, against the wall so haven’t experienced any issues with it sliding away which was previously mentioned. I’m glad I chose this one- I looked @ a ton before purchasing. And no- I don’t get paid for reviews etc :)
customer_reviews.author: Kat Trumble

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wait, buy this now
customer_reviews.text: This is the quietest bike! Even on 8 it’s super quiet. Like one of the other reviewers said, you have to work your way up to a higher tension. If you bike all day at your desk at a 2 or 3 you’ll be fine. Any higher all day, you’ll probably hate your life. I love that I can move this to different rooms and that I don’t have a giant bike sitting in my basement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy User: I Love These But Short Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these and my family uses these almost every day. The one I use recently started having issues - the pedals won’t stay screwed tightly in; I have to retighten them every day (and I apply as much pressure as possible to the bolts/nuts but to no avail). The pedal joints are also shedding a black grease powder-like substance which makes the floor beneath them a mess. Excluding this, I really love these, and they are built well. I’ve just bought a replacement unit for myself, but wish these would last longer for the price they cost.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Jensen

customer_reviews.title: and I think I would love it if I was taller
customer_reviews.text: It looks very well made, and I think I would love it if I was taller. I'm 5'2" on a good day. There was just literally no way for me to get my feet comfortably into those pedals. I tried moving the bike closer, moving the chair closer.I put my chair on the lowest setting.it was some sort of contortion game. I still really like the idea, and the bike looks great. Maybe just add a disclaimer that may not work for short people.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Errett

customer_reviews.title: Fits right under my desk
customer_reviews.text: My coworker brought in a DeskCycle and started using it a few months ago. I was impressed with how quiet it was. I finally caved and got one of my own because I spend most of my work day sitting. It was fairly easy to set up and start using. I'm hoping that I will use it a lot each day but for right now it is a matter of getting used to using it. :) I don't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda L. B.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I love having a DeskCycle at work. It's easy to assemble, and it is very quiet. So far I've just used it on the low settings, but even on the low settings, I can feel that I'm working my muscles. I sit so much at work that I sometimes get sore just from sitting. I'm going to incorporate more stretching, walking stairs, and using the DeskCycle into my daily work routine. I am extremely pleased with the quality of the DeskCycle, and I would recommend it enthusiastically!
customer_reviews.author: PK Adventure Team

customer_reviews.title: One of the best investments I've ever made!
customer_reviews.text: This marvelous machine might be saving my life! I worked from a home office for the first time this past year after a sudden career change. I wasn't used to spending so much time in a chair, and began feeling more and more antsy and weak as the days went on. I've owned the deskcycle for just over a week now, and I've already toned up a lot! It's about as quite as air blowing out of a vent, and because it's a belt system and not gears, it works so smoothly and wonderfully. One of the best investments I've ever made!
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Hoped It Would Be
customer_reviews.text: I have spinal stenosis and a knee that will eventually need to be replaced, so I am not able to do much exercising. My doctor suggested that I try the DeskCycle. I did my research, and decided to make the investment. It was very easy to assemble, taking me less than 10 minutes. I was worried that it would move around and/or make noise and disturb my downstairs neighbor, but It is totally undetectable. I use it multiple times a day, and It does not bother my back or my knee. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nanabunny

customer_reviews.title: Good but wouldn't recommend for non-carpeted floors
customer_reviews.text: This is everything most reviewers say it is. It's easy to assemble, quiet, and seems sturdy. The resistance settings are more meaningful than I was expected - each one is clearly different than the next. However, I'm using it with a rolling desk chair on a floor with a plastic mat. The chair moves around everywhere, and the velcro strap you're supposed to use to tether the chair is worthless. It just unvelcros immediately if you give it tension. I'll probably just find a firm rope to tether it or find something to put behind the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Some Dude

customer_reviews.title: Burn calories while you watch TV
customer_reviews.text: Using this when watching TV on my cough in the evenings. Helps to burn calories. Can burn about 200-250cal during a 30 min show. Already feel my legs getting slightly stronger. You don't get a full body sweaty work out but do get to burn calories when you would just be sitting on the couch. I'm not interested in using this at work as I bounce around from a standing desk to my ball chair at my normal desk.
customer_reviews.author: Amola S.

customer_reviews.title: 5/5 Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This was the best investment for me in 2020, health wise. I bought it right before covid blew up. I’m a tax accountant; my job requires long days of sitting. With the pandemic, my steps were even reduced more - the only steps I was getting in during tax seasons was around the house. This has helped me not feel so guilty and is quite therapeutic. While it is not a replacement for actual exercise, it helps a lot for those with jobs like mine. I would recommend to all office workers!
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, quiet and effective
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, quiet and surprisingly effective! I ride outdoors and do spin classes and this little guy gets me sweating! I don’t use it for anything too intense but it is such a great option when watching TV, reading or working - great little workout and great for circulation. I recommend a firm back/seat chair with a small pillow behind your back. No cord and very convenient to use, move and store.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble , easy to use ,good exercise device
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much . I have a heart problem so when for some reason I can not walk outside I use my desk cycle to make my heart beat faster or while I’m watching TV I pedal with the resistance to make the stronger muscle on my legs . Actually after I got it my son and my sister got it too .
customer_reviews.author: farideh  phisooph

customer_reviews.title: Nearly silent operation.
customer_reviews.text: A durable product. Very quiet. Compact. Smooth turning flywheel. May need to tie down on smooth surfaces. I would rate it perfect if like similar desk bikes it had an option to use for upper body workouts. It would be an easy fix.. replace pedals with hand grips.
customer_reviews.author: G. Coniglio

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this a few years ago and it is still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this desk cycle as a sedentary college student studying for hours on end and it continues to be absolutely wonderful. Affordable. Portable. I've tweaked the system but currently use it with the Lifetime 4428 Height Adjustable Folding Utility Table and foam mat floor tiles, which were purchased in a set of ~6-9 square-shaped mats at Sam's Club for 20$, and the Ikea Nolmyra chair. This works as I am only 5'2". I can study on my laptop for hours while getting a bit of exercise.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great for the office.
customer_reviews.text: Been using every day at work for a year (around 50mi a day) and still very happy with it. I find it works best with a tall wobble chair and standing desk, but chocking wheels on a normal office chair works well too. Even after so many miles it is still quiet enough that the person in the next cubicle can't hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I just set this thing up and started testing it. Overall I like it. It was easy to assemble and it was simple to operate. I worked up a bit of a sweat using it while watching TV. That’s a good thing because it means I can now make healthy use of my previous sedentary activities. One concern I have is that the housing makes a little sound while in use. As long as that sound does not get any louder, I can live with it. In addition this thing is a little heavy and a bit bulky. That said overall I have a positive initial impression of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating and difficult and so far impossible to attach the pedals
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet been able to get the pedals to attach to the bike. Very frustrating. My daughter will come help this weekend. So far, very frustrating. I noticed on line that many people have the same problem and I wonder wh6 they don’t send it out with the pedals attached.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie F

customer_reviews.title: Great For A Little Extra Exercise
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy, somewhat heavy under-desk cycle. You can use it wherever you have an appropriate chair. It links up to your fitbit, gives you different readings for calories, mile, etc., is very smooth when peddling, and was fairly easy to assemble. Nice to help you fit in a little extra exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Easy to use. What i find difficult....I use sitting on my couch....but at times it is in the way. It is heavy, and not easy for me to move.....the peddles are ok, but the straps on them need to be adjusted for socks, slippers, shoes, boots. Thinking about removing the straps. The tension has 8 settings, and easy to move up as I progress. Over all, I am very happy with this. Helps me get in some type of exercise that is not too strenuous on my knees or hips or back!
customer_reviews.author: Memaw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has Parkinson’s and needs to sit in a supportive chair but still get exercise. This is perfect for him! Very well made product, quiet, sturdy, functions perfectly. Clear directions, went together well, packaged nicely with everything you need for assembly. So glad I spent the money and didn’t get him one of the less expensive ones. You get what you pay for in this case; worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: LaraBee

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Daily Exercise!!
customer_reviews.text: I sit at a desk all day. I need to have more movement throughout the day. Customers have no idea that I am peddling under my desk. I can change the resistance by twisting the dial with my foot. Have gained muscel and speed. Easy to record daily miles, minutes, etc with calculator. I couldn't believe how easy and fun the desk cycle is or how many strides are converted into steps. I can't wait for the Android device to attach to my Fitbit. Easy set up. Convenient. Co-workers are jealous. Three Co workers have bought their own desk cycle. One of them is a professional cyclist. Best desk cycle bike on the market. Lost 52 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I sit at my desk and work 10-12 hours a day and wanted something to keep me going. This bike desk is amazing, the tension controls are great for such a small compact bike. It's extremely quite and fits perfectly under my desk. I love that the tracking monitor detaches and can sit on your desk so you can keep an eye on how long you've been riding/ distance. Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: tiaalesewong

customer_reviews.title: Good machine but very situational
customer_reviews.text: This is a well designed product, but its usage is very situational. With the proper desk setup, it's probably a useful and convenient way to get some exercise. In my case, my desk was too low and my chair is on wheels. I constantly banged my knees or found my chair sliding backwards. If there was a specific app to go with the machine, I might have kept it to use in my living room; but I found trying to use the designated webpage to be cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: TFP

customer_reviews.title: Noisy Cycle
customer_reviews.text: I loved this at first!! So quiet and a easy to use.. after about a month it starting to make a clicking noise on the right hand side as I cycle.. I’m not sure how to fix it.. I tried tightening everything.. however I can no longer use it at work as it is noisy .. I’m only giving it 2 stars because I can’t use it what it’s intended for.
customer_reviews.author: SWPoncho

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, sturdy and well built. Super smooth and quiet when pedaling. I use it every night while sitting on the couch watching TV. There is a small amount of assembly required but it comes with the necessary tools and is fairly easy. The only thing I didn't like was the pedal straps, but you can remove them, which I did. They're not really necessary and to me just get in the way, so off they came. Overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Asmr

customer_reviews.title: Truly effortless exercise and muscle strengthening
customer_reviews.text: I am a sedentary, overweight 50-year-old. I recommend the DeskCycle along with sitting on a balance/stability disc to strengthen core muscles. I’ve used my DeskCycle at work for six weeks and have worked my way up to resistance level 4, peddaling between 20-25 miles each workday. Without changing any other habits, I’ve lost about 5 lbs and my resting heart rate has fallen by 6 bpm. The best outcome to date is how strengthening my leg and core muscles has erased aches and pains I had begun experiencing.
customer_reviews.author: Pizzercat

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but not under the desk
customer_reviews.text: This bike didn't work for me as an under desk bike. First of all it is impossible to use if you are sitting on a chair that has wheels of swivels. The chair moves away from the desk every time I push the pedals, and I hit my knees on under the desk, even though my desk is pretty high. I am 5'7". Any way, I use it but not under the desk. It is a good tool to get your heart pumping and break a sweat while not leaving your house. Will keep it, but a little bit disappointed
customer_reviews.author: AnnaF

customer_reviews.title: Day one: so far so good...
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered one day earlier so that was a good thing. I checked all parts to make sure they weren’t used before and they seemed new, just a tiny hard to see scratches on the clear plastic on the machine, not a big deal. Assembly was pretty straight forward and intuitive, tool needed was included. We bought this for my mother, well keep an eye on functionality and will update review as time goes by. Hope all works well since this machine was not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little exerciser! It's everything I expected. It's a little heavier than I would like, but I read the reviews and knew this before I ordered it. I purchased it prior to knee replacement surgery to strengthen my legs. I love the adjustability of resistance and how unbelievably quiet it is! I'm now to weeks post-op and can't wait to get clearance from my surgeon to begin using it again! It's definitely going to be a major part of my recovery program.
customer_reviews.author: Steen

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I have some mobility issues and am also high risk for Covid, so quit going to the gym. I wanted something that didn't take a lot of room in my apartment. I found this and it's worked out well for me. I can use it while I'm watching tv or playing on my iPad. It's easy to use, convenient as it can be placed anywhere, and the cost was reasonable. Seems well made as well. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MiekePB

customer_reviews.title: Desk Cycle, great online tracking
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with desk cycle. I purchased one for at work and one for home. It’s a huge space saver. The best part is that I can sync it with my Fitbit. It also offers online tracking of data. (See the photos.). They’re supposed to create an app for the desk cycle. I’m looking forward to it and will update the post again.
customer_reviews.author: Leena

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect! I got it for my husband for his 30th birthday (his request, haha). He wanted something to help him burn some calories while at work. It was such an easy setup! It is SO quiet and perfect for the office setting. He's obsessed with it... and even started losing some weight because of it! He's so proud of himself and that's the most important.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is solid
customer_reviews.text: I really like how heavy duty this equipment is. It's really a stationary bike without the seat and handles. It's not light but that keeps it stable. I can easily get 5 miles a day in while reading or working with no problem. I'm still a beginner so I'll probably up the resistance as time goes on. I have it set to 3. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Pala

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but less than great execution
customer_reviews.text: It's a good, heavy-duty cycling set-up. It's quiet, and the difficulty levels are good. My only issue is that it's too big to comfortably cycle under a desk, especially if you're taller. I'm 5'9 and cannot use it under my desk (standard height) without knocking my knees into it. I missed the return deadline, so I'll be keeping it. It does work well while watching TV on the couch.
customer_reviews.author: MariaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Practical & discreet
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this thing. Basically all his co-workers are jealous and are always asking to give it a spin. The first day he bungee corded it to his cubicle to keep it from moving, but then he realized he got more of a core workout if he used his own strength and posture to keep it stable. Definitely practical for those that work long hours at a desk! I feel better knowing he's getting some cardio in and keeping his blood circulating. He also says it doesn't make much noise at all, so it can easily be used in a crowded office without distracting others.
customer_reviews.author: megan3132

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product For My Blood Circulation
customer_reviews.text: My DeskCycle is just what the doctor ordered. I am a senior that has a blood circulation problem in my feet plus I need more aerobics since our club house gym is closed (COVID19). The DeskCycle is easy to assemble, excellent instructions,, quiet, and comfortable to ride. I can already feel the improvement after just a couple of weeks. I have had no problem with "sliding" on my carpeted study. Only negative would be it's a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Double D

customer_reviews.title: Lasts about as long as a goldfish from the fair.
customer_reviews.text: My 73 year old father wore his out after a year and a half, the piece connecting the pedals to the main piece of equipment (the screw) came apart and I mean the screw broke in half while I was trying to undo it. If a piece of exercise equipment cannot withstand a 73 year old doing this for an hour a day then it's not going to last anybody very long. The less expensive ones are worth it, they are harder to increase the pressure but you won't be buying one every two months for yourself or your elderly relatives.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Finn

customer_reviews.title: Height needed to pedal
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this. I have not one seat in my home that this will work with. Couch too low, dining table chairs too low whacking my knees if I wanted to be on laptop during this. I'm 5'6. Really wondering how anyone else manages. Wasted 200.00
customer_reviews.author: sparky47

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boredom prevention
customer_reviews.text: Finally, something to keep me active to avoid the dreaded chair butt. 21 years behind a desk can wreak havoc on a girls figure. I get up and walk for breaks but this is really cool. I don’t peddle so long to break a sweat so I know when to back off and take a break from it. My only issue is it rolls away on carpet but I learned to hook one of my rolling chair wheels in front of it kind of hooking it from moving back.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: it is super quiet, can barely hear it
customer_reviews.text: I am rehabing from foot surgery where I cannot walk yet but can exercise. This has been a godsend. it is super quiet, can barely hear it, is very well constructed, feels solid. is easily moved from one location in the house to another and has multiple tension settings. I wear a Fitbit and can get my heart rate up on this easily with higher settings. I am actually using it as I type this. I do up to 2 hours a day in 20-30 minute increments and can already feel my quads coming back to life. Superb machine. Would buy again and recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Victoria L. San Juan

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine with some trial and error
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my office. Easy to operate and put together, Love it as my legs dont hurt from sitting 9 hours plus i stay warmer in the office airco. Took some trial and error to figure out the right chair height and distance. I had to order a booster seat as well. And using a belt to keep my chair in place. All depends on your length and proportions. But once i got situated i am happily biking through my conference calls. One regret, wish i had thought of it years ago! Best idea ever.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for a couple weeks now and I love it. It took a day or so to get used to cycling while working, but I have it down pat at this point and couldn't be happier. Definitely makes me feel more energetic and has also helped encourage me to get up and go to the gym at lunch. Would absolutely recommend to anyone who is looking for a solution to just sitting still at your desk all day.
customer_reviews.author: David R

product_meta.title: DeskCycle Under Desk Cycle,Pedal Exerciser - Stationary Mini Exercise Bike - Office, Home Equipment Peddler
feature_bullets: STAY FIT IN THE OFFICE - Our high-quality portable under desk bike keeps you focused, improves productivity and burns calories at your home desk or in the office
WORKS WITH LOW DESKS - As low as 27 inches
PATENTED MAGNETIC RESISTANCE MECHANISM- Quiet, smooth, and healthy pedal motion - great for your joints, and lets you focus on your work
8 CALIBRATED RESISTANCE SETTINGS - from very easy to challenging and more than 2x the range of other pedal exercisers!
1000 MINUTE, 5 FUNCTION LCD DISPLAY - shows speed, time, distance, calories and scan; Online calorie burned calculator available

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
